definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

pinyin: t o n y lao3 shi1

sentences.english: Now she is a teacher of Diligent Education, teaching middle school students, mainly engaged in teaching English.
sentences.chinese: 现是用心教育中学部老师，主要从事英语的教学。

sentences.english: If the teacher is a lamp, I'm reluctant to burning wick.
sentences.chinese: 如果老师是一盏灯，我就是舍不得燃烧的灯芯。

sentences.english: Teachers squeeze the knowledge into the heads of the students.
sentences.chinese: 老师将知识硬塞进学生的头脑中。

sentences.english: Big brother says the paper is due tomorrow, or else.
sentences.chinese: 老师说，论文明天应交，否则后果由个人负责。

sentences.english: At the activity class, I helped our teacher to make the music.
sentences.chinese: 在活动课上，我帮助我的英语老师剪辑音乐。

sentences.english: Our Chinese teachers are warm-hearted. We've learned a lot here.
sentences.chinese: 我们的中国老师很热情，在这里，我们学到很多知识。

sentences.english: Mr Qin is our history teacher. He has a wonderful name Qin Han.
sentences.chinese: 秦先生是我们的历史老师，他有一个好听的名字秦汉。

sentences.english: Today madam Gao is wearing a red skirt.
sentences.chinese: 当今高老师穿着一件红裙子。

sentences.english: I have some problems at home these days could you please ask Mr. Wang for permission to leave?
sentences.chinese: 我这几天家里有事，你能帮我向王老师请假吗？

sentences.english: Though she meant well, she was often chastised for being the teacher's pet.
sentences.chinese: 虽然她是好意，可她因为是老师的宠儿而常被惩罚。

sentences.english: Our teacher is known for her fairness in grading pupils.
sentences.chinese: 我们的老师以给学生评分公平著称。

sentences.english: John:I have a new English teacher.
sentences.chinese: 我换了一名新的英语老师。

sentences.english: Even so, some teachers still gave us homework.
sentences.chinese: 即便如此，有些老师还是布置了寒假作业。

definition: teacher in charge of a class
to study at the same school/fellow student/classmate/CL:位[wei4],個|个[ge4]
to give classes/to work as a teacher
to go to class/to attend class/to go to teach a class
head of a household/family head/patriarch/parent or guardian of a child
to attend a class/to go to a lecture
to teach/teaching and learning/education/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4]
